metadata.title: CVE-2021-44142 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
The Samba vfs_fruit module uses extended file attributes (EA, xattr) toprovide "...enhanced compatibility with Apple SMB clients andinteroperability with a Netatalk 3 AFP fileserver." Samba versions prior to4.13.17, 4.14.12 and 4.15.5 with vfs_fruit configured allow out-of-boundsheap read and write via specially crafted extended file attributes. Aremote attacker with write access to extended file attributes can executearbitrary code with the privileges of smbd, typically root.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
python3-samba - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
registry-tools - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-libs - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
smbclient - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
winbind - 4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1').
